business.headline: Should you convert your credit card bills into EMIs? Check hereConverting credit card bills into EMIs offers immediate relief by breaking big payments into smaller and manageable amounts.
What is UPI Circle? 5 things you need to know UPI Circle is a solution where a primary user authorises a secondary user to make payments from their account.

IT rally saves the day on Dalal Steet; Wipro, Infosys among top gainersThe biggest gainers during the session were IT stocks, with the Nifty IT index rising 2.14%, the highest among all other sectoral indices.

Budget 2025: Why financial services sector needs a 'digital lending' boostBudget 2025 would play a key role in driving the country's economic growth through enhanced credit access to the rural and underserved sectors of the economy.

HDFC Bank Q3 results: Net profit rises 2.2% to Rs 16,736 croreThe private lender reported a 7.6% increase in interest earned, which came to Rs 76,007 crore compared to Rs 70,583 in the same quarter of the previous financial year.

Budget 2025: How government can provide relief to taxpayersBudget 2025 and income tax: The country's vast middle-class population is also calling for the inclusion of tax-saving provisions and deductions under the new income tax regime.

Will Donald Trump's tariff suspense hurt Indian stocks? All you need to knowDonald Trump has also threatened BRICS nations with up to 100% tariffs against taking a decision that could lead to de-dollarisation of the global economy.

Budget 2025: 3 things government should focus on to tackle climate changeBudget 2025 expectations: Experts said climate action is the need of the hour and announcements related to clean energy will be crucial. There could be a push to boost green jobs as well.

Explained: Why ICICI Prudential shares tumbled 10% after Q3 resultsICICI Prudential share price: The company's share price decline came a day after Q3FY25 results, where it reported a 43% rise in net profit to Rs 326 crore.

Zomato shares down over 23% in a month. Should you buy or avoid?Zomato share price: The food delivery giant's stock price has fallen over 14% in the previous two sessions and over 23% in the past month.

Denta Water IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPDenta Water and Infra Solutions IPO: The price band for the IPO of Denta Water has been set at Rs 279-294 per share with retail investors required to invest a minimum of Rs 14,700. The minimum lot size for an application is 50.

HDFC Bank to announce Q3 results today: Here's what to expectHDFC Bank Q3 FY25 Results Expectations: Investors will be keeping a keen eye on the results as the stock of HDFC Bank has fallen 8.62% in the last month.

Budget 2025: Raghuram Rajan says tax cuts won't solve India's fiscal problemsFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that he is not worried about the reduction in tax rates but instead about the need for more effective government spending, particularly in human capital development.

Stocks to watch today: HCLTech, HDFC Bank, HUL, Tata Communication, ZomatoHDFC Bank, Hindustan Unilever (HUL), and Tata Communication will be announcing their Q3 FY25 results today, hence their stocks will likely see some action.

Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan speaks on Trump's tariffs, job creation and othersFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan highlighted his views on issues like US President Donald Trump's plans to impose tariffs on some countries, including India, and how the economy and job creation is progressing under the Narendra Modi-led central government.

Concern for world, won't benefit US much: Raghuram Rajan on Trump tariff threatSpeaking to India Today TV, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan warned that US President Donald Trump's tariff plans could harm global economic stability, increase costs, and deter foreign investment.
A decade of budget evolution under ModiCoalition dynamics could influence future budgetary decisions, particularly in the welfare sector. Will the government maintain its current priorities?

What to expect from Budget 2025: Growth, taxes, and fiscal realities in numbersFY25's deficit is projected at 4.9 per cent of the GDP, or Rs 16.1 trillion. Despite slower economic growth, the government is expected to stick to its fiscal discipline plan.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 11 dead after passengers jump off train suspecting fire, run over by anotherPassengers of the Pushpak Express pulled the emergency chain and jumped off the train, fearing a fire, only to be hit by the Karnataka Express in Jalgaon which was coming from the opposite direction.

JDU's damage control, sacks leader for 'no support to BJP in Manipur' letterThe JD(U) on Wednesday sacked its Manipur unit chief Kshetrimayum Biren Singh for writing a letter saying the party doesn't support the BJP in the state.

Behind-the-scenes 'account' of Vivek Ramaswamy's exit from now-Elon Musk-run DOGEVivek Ramaswamy's departure from DOGE has left Elon Musk as the sole leader of the department that is envisioned to clean up federal bureaucracy. But what went behind the scenes before Ramaswamy's unexpected exit?

What should an Indian teenager's skincare routine look like?Not giving a damn about skincare at all or overwhelming your skin with every possible viral skincare product - indulging in either route - is not ideal for teenagers.

India jersey to feature Champions Trophy logo with Pakistan imprint: BCCIIndian team jersey will feature host Pakistan's names during the Champions Trophy, BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia said on Wednesday, 22 January. Saikia quashed the rumours that the BCCI wanted Pakistan's name to be removed from the Champions Trophy logo for their jersey.

Why Pataudi properties are labelled as 'enemy property'Saif Ali Khan is embroiled in a legal battle over his family's ancestral properties, valued at Rs 15,000 crore, after the Madhya Pradesh High Court lifted a 2015 stay, potentially allowing the government to seize the assets under the Enemy Property Act.

Farooq Abdullah draws 'Indians in US' analogy over Saif's Bangladeshi attackerThe suspect arrested in the Saif Ali Khan stabbing case had entered India illegally from Bangladesh. Farooq Abdullah contended that an entire nation can't be blamed for one attack and went on to draw the analogy of Indians migrating to the US.

Paatal Lok is a stunner, and a rarity that gets Nagaland and Nagas rightPaatal Lok Season 2: By weaving Nagaland's cultural nuances and history into a gripping narrative, Prime Video series Pataal Lok Season 2, achieves a rare first. It shatters stereotypes and avoids the northeast exoticism trap. With breathtaking visuals and sensitive storytelling, Paatal Lok Season 2 has set a benchmark for mainstream portrayals of the northeast region of India.

Republic Day will change how you marry, divorce or live-in in Uttarakhand A Uniform Civil Code in the state from January 26 will reform personal laws across religions, but the transformative exercise faces logistical, social and political challenges

CBI can, not state: Agency opposes Bengal's plea against life term in RG Kar caseThe Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday opposed the West Bengal government's appeal before the Calcutta High Court against the life imprisonment sentence to Sanjay Roy, who was convicted of the rape and murder of a trainee doctor at RG Kar hospital in Kolkata last year.

Saif hugs auto driver who took him to hospital, mother Sharmila blesses himSaif Ali Khan met the auto driver who took him to the hospital following the knife attack on January 16. The actor's mother, Sharmila Tagore, thanked him.

Did Mark Zuckerberg like Lauren Sanchez's pic? Here's what X users thinkSeveral X users have flooded social media with screenshots suggesting that Mark Zuckerberg liked one of Lauren Sanchez's Instagram posts. Did he really do that? Read on to know more.

Chaos in lives of Indians on H-1B, L1 visas, their children in US. Here's whyThe lives of thousands of Indians and their families in the US on work visas like L1 and H-1B are going to witness a big change. As President Donald Trump orders cancellation of birthright citizenship, the children of Indians on work permits and in Green Card queues are going to be hit. Either they have to self-deport, or take up visas.

Kamala Harris returns to her LA home; embarrassment, say some, hero say othersFormer US vice president Kamala Harris is back home in Los Angeles. She is meeting LA wildfire firefighters and distributing food to evacuees. But her neighbours have mixed reactions. Some say they are embarrassed, while others hail her "home town hero".
The Trump link in Canada's call for immediate electionA recent poll shows that 77% of Canadians are calling for an immediate federal election, despite it being scheduled for around October.
How can BJP neutralise the edge AAP enjoys in Delhi polls?The BJP hopes that the Congress will dent the AAP's Muslim and Sikh votes, neutralising its 10 and two per cent leads respectively.

What is JioCoin and how can you earn it for free?JioCoin is a blockchain-based reward token built by Jio and Polygon labs using Ethereum Layer 2. Despite the name it is not a classic crypto currency coin. Instead, it is similar to reward points that can be earned for free by Jio users.

Top Hezbollah commander Sheikh Hammadi shot dead in front of house in LebanonHammadi died on the spot on Tuesday night as unidentified assailants opened fire and shot the senior Hezbollah official six times.

The woman is Shivon Zilis who shares three children with him.

With the double strike, he went past Yuzvendra Chahal's tally for the most wickets by an Indian in the shortest format of the game.

Maharashtra announce Gaikwad-led squad for Ranji Trophy match vs BarodaRanji Trophy 2024-25: Maharashtra named their squad for their upcoming clash against Baroda, starting Thursday, January 23. Ruturaj Gaikwad will lead them in their penultimate match of the group stage.

Watch: Buttler gives autograph to fan on wheelchair ahead of T20I vs IndiaJos Buttler won hearts in Kolkata by signing a bat for specially abled Indian fan Dharamveer Pal, ahead of England's T20I opener against India, showcasing his connection with fans off the field.

On India return, Mohammed Shami eyes Kapil Dev's record IND vs ENG: Indian fast bowler Mohammed Shami is on the cusp of a major landmark in international as he makes his return in the upcoming T20I series against England, starting January 22 in Kolkata.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
